title: Bhopal disaster
summary: The Bhopal disaster, also referred to as the Bhopal gas tragedy, was a gas leak incident on the night of 2â€“3 December 1984 at the Union Carbide India Limited (UCIL) pesticide plant in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, India. It is considered among the world's worst industrial disasters.[1][2] Over 500,000 people were exposed to methyl isocyanate (MIC) gas. The highly toxic substance made its way into and around the small towns located near the plant.[3]
